Author: queensnake
Title: 7 Reasons to Get Away To Unleash Your Best Ideas

Author: edgeztv
Content:
If I was a potential buyer I'd see someone selling a site just 4 days after launch as a big red flag. Was the developer's confidence in it's potential so low that they chose to take a sum equivalent to 4 months' salaray (assuming they're not 16) rather than ride the wave?

On the other hand, maybe they're on to something - repeatedly build sites with cool design, get a mention on Tech Crunch, and flip.

Author: ivankirigin
Content:
I'm sure you're familiar with Kurzweil and his love of fitting lines on logarithmic plots. http://www.kurzweilai.net/articles/art0134.html?printable=1 http://www.kk.org/thetechnium/Blog_Kurzweil.gif

He has an interesting plot where he takes a number of opinions about the most important events ever (e.g. fire, farming, etc.), and plots them all on a logarithmic time plot. The line fit to the 20 or so opinions is very apparent.

Author: aston
Content: After that, I think you should buy Facebook.

Author: paulgb
Content: There may be an official list somewhere, but Wikipedia has a decent list: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y_Combinator#Portfolio

Author: christefano
Content:
I use CiviCRM. It may not be perfect for you, as you seem to have decided on Highrise, but CiviCRM is perfect for me. Integrating it into my existing sites is a breeze.

http://civicrm.org/
